column1: I’m angered by the dismissal of this landmark suit. Congress *must* take action on climate change—As Chair of the Transportation Committee I’m drafting a bill that will invest in green technologies & bring our transportation systems into the 21st century. https://t.co/uTyF7iNWlj

I've visited refugee camps around the world—What I saw today is a disgrace to the United States.   The conditions to which we are submitting asylum-seekers is inhumane plain and simple. This crisis is a direct result the #RemainInMexico policy and it must end at once. https://t.co/8GrFJoJo1H

Medical personnel on the ground say the situation in Matamoros is so bad they need the same type of support and infrastructure that is given to the formal refugee camps in the Middle East. #DemsAtTheBorder #DontLookAway https://t.co/9RsvPFnlHt

@ACLUTx @TXCivilRights @ABA_Immigration Briefing from Mike with Team Brownsville a volunteer organization providing humanitarian assistance and Sister Norma from @CCharitiesUSA. Matamoros has neither the medical resources nor infrastructure to accommodate the asylum-seekers. https://t.co/3iE0O1d20G

@ACLUTx @TXCivilRights @ABA_Immigration Preparing to enter Matamoros Mexico where more than 3K asylum-seekers are waiting for their claims to be processed. The conditions at the tent camps are inhumane with reports of violence kidnappings sexual assault and widespread illness. https://t.co/1TzosPAcv6

Today I am visiting the U.S.-Mexico border to see firsthand the impact of the Trump Administration's #RemainInMexico policy.  First up: a meeting with @ACLUTx @TXCivilRights  and @ABA_Immigration. https://t.co/EfvJZbrkMa

Secretary DeVos is refusing to forgive 97% of loans taken out by students who have been defrauded by predatory for-profit colleges. I voted today to correct her shameful policy. The Secretary works for taxpayers and students not special interests: https://t.co/Dy9xzdNYAe

Today the House appointed impeachment managers and sent two articles of impeachment to the Senate. Now it’s up to the Senate to hold a fair trial—including allowing necessary documents and witness testimonies—on the President's betrayal of the Constitution. History is watching.

A century ago today Oregon became the 25th state to ratify the #19thAmendment taking the first step towards granting all women the right to vote. Oregon's suffragists made major strides in expanding access to the ballot box—a fight that continues today. #womensvote100 https://t.co/SSrhdVMhGG

Pharmaceutical companies raised prices on more than 400 Rx drugs in the first week of 2020 but Mitch McConnell is still blocking House-passed legislation in the Senate to #LowerDrugCosts. Oregonians need relief from the unrelenting greed of Big Pharma.  https://t.co/9iMdAmQ2LC

Following President Trump's reckless actions in the Middle East I sat down with C-SPAN’s @stevescully this week to discuss my war powers legislation and the need for Congress to reassert its constitutional war powers authority. https://t.co/f3oXgTyZS6 https://t.co/bVpTGA3Xvr

PFAS chemicals or “forever chemicals” have been linked to several adverse health effects. Every day millions of Americans are exposed to unsafe levels of PFAS through their drinking water. I'm proud to have voted in support of the PFAS Action Act to protect the public health. https://t.co/N5YzeAErKf
Congratulations to Superintendent Gustavo Balderas of Eugene 4J School District—Oregon’s Superintendent of the Year and a finalist for the National Superintendent of the Year! https://t.co/wUViv9EaEJ

Trump put our troops in harm’s way with his reckless assassination of Suleimani. Instead of violent attacks that may potentially to lead to all-out war Congress must stop this march towards war. We cannot afford to become mired in another endless conflict in the Middle East.

George W. Bush’s invasion of Iraq mired U.S. troops in a never-ending conflict and was the worst foreign policy mistake in recent history. However Trump’s dangerous efforts to provoke Iran into war may have even greater consequences. https://t.co/CnUXRws5Nl

Trump's order to assassinate Iran's top military leader will have a major impact across the Middle East and may endanger American servicemembers' lives. Congress must assert its Constitutionally-granted war powers to ensure the US does not become mired in yet another endless war.

Boeing executives made critical decisions about the 737 MAX based on Wall Street--not on safety. As Chair of the Transportation Committee I'm leading the investigation into the failures in the system that led to the tragic loss of 346 lives. https://t.co/BFReCVLLdp
Congratulations to the Rose Bowl champions @oregonfootball!!! #GoDucks #RoseBowl

“Adm. William McRaven—the man who oversaw the raid that killed Bin Laden—believes Trump is the greatest threat facing American democracy. How voters respond to that danger in the new year may well determine the arc of our future for a generation to come.” https://t.co/pGYaZO8o8Y

The documents Boeing has sent to Congress continue to paint a disturbing picture of safety concerns. As Chair of the Transportation Committee I’m leading the investigation into what went wrong and how we can ensure the safety of the flying public. https://t.co/KWWCmmkIW3

The Trump administration's ongoing full-throated attack on the Affordable Care Act is putting affordable healthcare coverage at-risk for millions of families. Now more than ever Congress needs to work to strengthen not dismantle healthcare protections: https://t.co/sc53YkGyXT

The Trump Administration is continuing its assault on the most vulnerable Americans now by making it more difficult for hundreds of thousands of beneficiaries to qualify for disability payments. I demand the administration withdraw this harmful proposal. https://t.co/wwiqfQmgwb

This vote is not something I take lightly but the case is clear-cut: President Trump has violated his oath of office and betrayed the Constitution and the American people. I fully support the articles of impeachment and will be voting in favor of them today. https://t.co/gWhOYPR4JN

The Trump administration is pushing for the largest rollback of clean water protections in history. As Chair of the Transportation Committee I'm fighting back against Trump's efforts to undo nearly 50 years of environmental protections. https://t.co/YX1vLM26IW

After working with House leadership to ensure OR rural counties were not left behind in the FY20 funding bill I’m pleased the bill includes a 2-year extension of the Secure Rural Schools program which provides vital funding for schools law enforcement and roads.

Last year the #GOPTaxScam allowed America’s largest corporations to pay an effective tax rate of 11.3%. Nearly 100 Fortune 500 companies paid NOTHING in federal taxes. We need policies that will support working families not just big corporations. https://t.co/cSzQKScME4

I've secured a huge win for OR Pacific groundfish fisheries today—the federal govt is expected to forgive a multi-million dollar interest burden created by bureaucratic incompetence. Proud to have worked with @SenJeffMerkley @RonWyden & @RepSchrader to finally right this wrong.
Open enrollment ends today December 15 — be sure to visit https://t.co/ABaaFhZWW7 to find a plan that works for you and your family.
FRAUD (noun):  Wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain:  https://t.co/NxQvoJve6S

Ride-sharing companies have an obligation to keep their riders and drivers safe. I’m proud to have introduced legislation that would require transportation companies to implement formal polices to help protect everyone from sexual harassment and assault. https://t.co/IoK2WBYj3q

Because of pharmaceutical companies’ price gouging Americans pay more out-of-pocket for Rx drugs than individuals in any other country. It’s beyond time for Congress to act to deliver immediate relief. That’s why  I voted for H.R. 3 the Elijah Cummings Lower Drug Costs Now Act. https://t.co/kcS88JFsHw

Our oceans which are so important to Oregon's coastal communities and our planet have absorbed nearly 1/3 of human-caused carbon emissions increasing acidity and harming marine life. We need a #BlueNewDeal to protect our oceans and the communities that depend on them.

Today I voted against the National Defense Authorization Act. While it includes a number of provisions I strongly support it is still a continuation of the status quo and falls far short of the more progressive bill the House passed earlier this year: https://t.co/JpvOiyHIs5 https://t.co/wVoRw4UFyY

Two years ago today Republicans pushed through their disastrous #GOPTaxScam. Last year 60 corps paid $0 in federal income taxes and received rebates totaling $4.3B. Because of the GOP working families pay more in federal income taxes than @Amazon @Netflix and @GM. https://t.co/PNOXzVbVv8

The Oregon coast is already experiencing the effects of climate change. That's why I voted for HR 729 to create and improve programs to help prepare for & respond to climate change protecting coastal residents fish habitat improving working waterfronts.

Met with @APWUnational today to discuss my bill the USPS Fairness Act that would repeal the requirement for USPS to pre-pay future retiree health benefits. Ending this ridiculous practice would allow USPS to invest those funds in improving service for all Americans. https://t.co/subzV9cGQM
Congratulations @uoregon Ducks 2019 PAC-12 Football Champions! #GoDucks https://t.co/vN4dhfHCQQ

The right to vote is the core foundation of our democracy. I am a cosponsor of HR 4 and voted for it today to restore the full strength of the Voting Rights Act strengthen federal tools to combat voter suppression and protect every American’s right to vote. https://t.co/voxbImWmYu

I will continue to push Uber and all other companies and agencies whose employees and customers are at risk of sexual assault and harassment to establish formal policies training and reporting structures. Here’s more on my bill:  https://t.co/L0ZqOYuDgx https://t.co/jxv48Bbayu

I’m thankful for the leadership of nations gathering at #COP25 to discuss the implementation of the Paris Agreement. New data shows the climate crisis is more dire than we previously predicted. The U.S. must take bold action to address this existential threat. #TimeForAction

The first in a series of Trump regulations finalized today will cut life-saving nutrition assistance from our poorest and most vulnerable when they need it most. Taking food from the tables of hungry people is wrong—during the holiday season is especially cruel. #HandsOffSNAP
Proud to host @BeaverBaseball 2018 College World Series Champions at the Capitol today. Congratulations! https://t.co/3CFmBvXWVJ

I am proud to be an original cosponsor of the 100% Clean Economy Act which sets a nationwide goal of achieving a 100% clean economy by 2050 while strengthening the economy by creating green collar jobs in rural and under served communities. #100x50 https://t.co/UjCSnHvCme

Proud to stand with the @USProgressives a group I founded in 1991 with Bernie Sanders Maxine Waters Ron Dellums Lane Evans and Tom Andrews to focus on growing income inequality and oppose the export of US jobs through free trade agreements. It’s now 98 members strong! https://t.co/Ca9loUgwZG

Proud @TransportDems passed several of my bills today: addressing sexual harassment in transportation establishing one standard of aircraft safety at foreign repair stations improving pipeline safety and reducing pipeline emissions. https://t.co/3wsytShYSi

This Trans Day of Remembrance we honor the lives of the transgender members of our community who we have lost to senseless acts of violence motivated by hate and bigotry. The Senate must act to prevent these tragedies and enact the Equality Act. #TDOR https://t.co/QXufdWAMlF

I’m proud to be an original co-sponsor of the Green New Deal for Public Housing Act which will de-fossilize public housing create thousands of good paying jobs and improve the quality of life for its residents.

I introduced legislation today to address sexual harassment and assault on airplanes passenger rail public transit buses cruise ships and in ride sharing vehicles. We need a safer transportation system for everyone. https://t.co/npT902Pt6Y

I was invited today to testify before the Select Cmte on the @ClimateCrisis. Climate change is an existential threat to the planet as we know it and we have a moral obligation to act aggressively and immediately. I shared my ideas on how we can do so: https://t.co/QoaDsnTzea https://t.co/5q4FjuwSAp

Thanks to @splcenter we have more evidence for what we already knew that WH aide Stephen Miller promotes white supremacist ideology and xenophobic conspiracy theories from his taxpayer-funded position in the Trump Administration. He should resign. https://t.co/95wP2j0xUj

The @registerguard reported in October that U.S. airlines mishandled at least 6915 wheelchairs between January and August—an average of 29 times a day: https://t.co/bSv3wfrIhS  I'm pressing the airlines to do better. https://t.co/ujecTQtgSc

I’m proud to welcome Oregon Rep. Nancy Nathanson @Rep_NN to my committee @TransportDems today to advocate for improved passenger rail service in Oregon: Young people seniors our gig economy and tech see the value in passenger trains and want more! https://t.co/Ac40YyTY4p

Today the House Judiciary Committee marked up legislation that would lift a ratification deadline on the Equal Rights Amendment – clearing the way for states like Virginia to ratify the ERA and finally affirm equal rights regardless of sex in the Constitution. #ERANow

At stake before SCOTUS today are the lives of 10k Dreamers in OR and 700k around the country--integral members of our community. I voted for the DREAM Act in 2010 and supported it every Congress since but it has died in the Senate. We need a permanent solution NOW. #DACA

As we prepare to commemorate Veterans Day this weekend we should renew our commitment to fulfilling our obligations to our veterans and their families who have served and sacrificed for our freedom. Thank you to America’s service members and veterans. We are a grateful nation. https://t.co/lZ3pjwLa1g

I had a great time at @FossMaritime in PDX meeting workers & piloting a diesel-electric hybrid tugboat made in Rainer. My recently passed bill to unlock the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund will help sustain our nation’s maritime economy & ensure local companies continue to thrive. https://t.co/Zuv3QYcown

The cost of leaving the Paris Climate Accord is immense and growing. The GAO estimates the cost of disaster assistance recovery and clean up from flooding fires and storms is more than $350 billion over the past decade. https://t.co/a7iG98Nqkr

Open enrollment for health coverage under the Affordable Care Act starts today! You have until Dec 15 to change or sign up for a plan. Nearly 70% who apply are eligible for some financial aid. Go to https://t.co/hGmHNRDQNI to #getcovered. https://t.co/HMPOFs2aV4

No one really wants to think about where poop goes after you flush until it winds up in our nation’s rivers and streams. My bill will provide over $16B to ensure that poop doesn’t contaminate our waters or endanger public health and the environment. https://t.co/lterXPkTPK https://t.co/CGsUD1nAyo

Trump has admitted to soliciting assistance from a foreign leader to interfere with elections and aid his political campaign a violation of the Constitution a betrayal of the American people and an impeachable offense. My statement on today's vote: https://t.co/SwE900nivs

The House just approved by a strong bipartisan vote my bill to increase investments in critical harbor and port projects finally unlocking the $9.5B in the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund to be used for its intended purpose. Time for the Senate to act! https://t.co/d1Ibh0Y3u4 https://t.co/6434D5969p

Our nation's seniors deserve to age with dignity. I was proud to see the House unanimously pass the Dignity in Aging Act - legislation that I cosponsored which would reauthorize the #OlderAmericansAct for the next 5 years and substantially increase funding for all #OAA services.

It’s clear that reforms will be needed to ensure that future safety-critical systems don’t create single points of failure that bring down new commercial aircraft designs. I will get to the bottom of the failures in the system. https://t.co/hTEiSEOJTH

Proud to celebrate today with Oceans Caucus Foundation @TheICCFGroup the success story of the West Coast Groundfish fishery which NOAA designated a federal disaster in 2000 and through responsible management enjoys an abundant sustainable fishery today. https://t.co/v7meS0DfON

The proposed pebble mine project could become the largest open pit mine in America covering up to 6.9 square miles and reaching a depth of as much as 3 quarters of a mile. To put that into perspective the maximum depth of the Grand Canyon is one mile.
About 31% of the world’s wild sockeye harvest which generates $1.5 billion annually & supports more than 10000 U.S. jobs depends on the Bristol Bay watershed. We must #StopPebble and #SaveBristolBay.

The Bristol Bay Alaska watershed is home to the largest salmon run in the world and critical to the Alaska native villages fishers and businesses but all of it is at risk if the Trump administration moves forward with the Pebble Mine project.

Today my committee held a hearing on the impacts of the proposed Pebble Mine Project pending review by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. I believe it’s another example of an abuse of power by this administration. https://t.co/WGnOy7H3pT

I fully support House committees drafting articles of impeachment against the president and hope for their prompt consideration in the House. (3/3)

Since he admitted his offense and despite his ongoing efforts to obstruct justice and the impeachment investigation further evidence has mounted against the president. His brazen and reckless actions threaten our national security and the very foundation of our democracy. (2/3)

The president has admitted to an impeachable offense—soliciting assistance from a foreign leader to interfere with U.S. elections and aid his political campaign. He has violated his oath of office to protect and defend the Constitution and betrayed the American people. (1/3)
